    Create a Personal Blog on GitHub pages With Jekyll themes

    Create personal blog with Github pages and Jekyll theme There is more than one way to do it, I found this way easier, just using Jekyll theme itself.
    Here is tutorial how to do it with Jekyll, its will teach more about Jekyll frame work: Jekyll Tutorial

    First we Create a new repository

    we need to clone our new repository copy this link

    open terminal type navigate to your desired folder and type

    It will clone your new repository then go and find your jekyll theme find a theme you like and open their GitHub I used a texture from thelehhman clone their repository to a different folder than your repository you created earlier

    now copy theme folder content to the folder of your repository if folders in the same directory use this command for mac terminal

    Or move/copy your content files with ctrl+c for copy and ctrl+v to paste.

    here are examples the files inside of your repository

    in your terminal type

    to see your files in your repository folder, we need to commit them to your Github account

    now you can go to your github account and see all your theme files. Go yo your settings scroll down till you see Github Pages that is your link to your website. Here is mine:
